alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:11PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Boyd, north central Lawrence, southern Cabell, northwestern Lincoln and northern Wayne Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 311 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ceredo, or near Beech Fork State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Wayne, Hamlin, Beech Fork State Park, Barboursville, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Ranger, Durbin, East Lynn Lake, Burnaugh, Centerville, Burlington, West Hamlin, Lockwood, Sweetland, Lavalette, Branchland and Buchanan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 190 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
